data.current_summary: Most Emailed by Section & Time Period
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve most emailed articles by section and time period
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of the most emailed New York Times articles for a specified section and time period. Accepts section name (e.g., 'world', 'politics') and time period in days (1, 7, or 30). Returns an array of articles ranked by email share count, with each article including metadata such as title, URL, byline, publication date, and email share metrics. Results are sorted in descending order by email shares.
data.reasoning: Original description is completely empty, making it impossible for AI agents to understand the operation's purpose, inputs, or outputs. Summary is generic and lacks actionability. Added specific details about accepted parameters, return structure, sorting behavior, and domain context (NYT articles, email metrics) to improve AI agent interpretability and enable proper operation selection.

data.current_summary: Most Shared by Section & Time Period
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve most shared articles by section and time period
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of the most shared New York Times articles for a specified section and time period. Accepts section name (e.g., 'world', 'politics') and time period in days (1, 7, or 30). Returns an array of articles ranked by social media share count, with each article including metadata such as title, URL, byline, publication date, and share metrics. Results are sorted in descending order by total shares.
data.reasoning: Original description is empty, preventing AI agents from understanding operation purpose, parameters, or response format. data.current_summary: Retrieve most viewed articles by section and time period
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of the most viewed New York Times articles for a specified section and time period. Accepts section name (e.g., 'world', 'politics') and time period in days (1, 7, or 30). Returns an array of articles ranked by page view count, with each article including metadata such as title, URL, byline, publication date, and view metrics. Results are sorted in descending order by total views.
